NAME: Staging Models Dependent on Other Staging Models
FINDINGS: Staging models depend on other staging models.
RISK: Indicates potential misnaming or incorrect dependencies.
BEST_PRACTICES: Rename or reconfigure the model to depend on sources or intermediate models.

NAME: Source Fanout
FINDINGS: A single source has multiple direct child models.
RISK: Duplicates transformation logic; harder to update if the source changes.
BEST_PRACTICES: Create a single staging model for each source and have other models reference it.

NAME: Rejoining of Upstream Concepts
FINDINGS: A model joins data already joined upstream, creating a "loop" in the DAG.
RISK: Unnecessary complexity and potential performance issues.
BEST_PRACTICES: Consolidate logic into a single model.

NAME: Model Fanout
FINDINGS: A single model has too many direct children.
RISK: Transformations might be better in the BI layer or consolidated.
BEST_PRACTICES: Move transformations to the BI layer or create intermediate models.

NAME: Downstream Models Dependent on Source
FINDINGS: Marts/intermediate models depend directly on sources.
RISK: Violates the principle of staging models as the atomic unit of data modeling.
BEST_PRACTICES: Add a staging model between the source and downstream model.

NAME: Direct Join to Source
FINDINGS: Models join directly to sources when a staging model exists.
RISK: Inconsistent transformation logic; duplicated code.
BEST_PRACTICES: Create a staging model and have other models reference it.

NAME: Duplicate Sources
FINDINGS: Multiple source nodes defined for the same database object.
RISK: Inaccurate lineage.
BEST_PRACTICES: Combine duplicate source nodes into one.

NAME: Hard Coded References
FINDINGS: Using hard-coded table/view names instead of ref() and source().
RISK: dbt can't infer dependencies or generate the DAG correctly.
BEST_PRACTICES: Replace with ref() for models and source() for raw data.

NAME: Multiple Sources Joined
FINDINGS: A single staging model joins data from multiple sources.
RISK: Violates the one-to-one relationship between staging models and sources.
BEST_PRACTICES: Create separate staging models for each source, then join them in an intermediate model.

NAME: Root Models
FINDINGS: Models have no defined parents.
RISK: dbt can't interpret lineage, potentially leading to errors.
BEST_PRACTICES: Ensure all models use ref() and source() to define dependencies.

NAME: Staging Models Dependent on Downstream Models
FINDINGS: Staging models depend on intermediate or marts models.
RISK: Violates the principle that staging models should only select from sources.
BEST_PRACTICES: Rename or reconfigure the model to depend on sources.

NAME: Unused Sources
FINDINGS: Sources are defined in YAML but not used.
RISK: Unnecessary clutter.
BEST_PRACTICES: Remove unused sources from the YAML file.

NAME: Models with Too Many Joins
FINDINGS: Models have excessive joins.
RISK: Increased complexity; harder to understand and maintain.
BEST_PRACTICES: Break down complex models into smaller ones.

NAME: Missing Primary Key Tests
COLUMN_NAME_LIST: RESOURCE_NAME, RESOURCE_TYPE, MODEL_TYPE, IS_PRIMARY_KEY_TESTED, NUMBER_OF_TESTS_ON_MODEL, NUMBER_OF_CONSTRAINTS_ON_MODEL
DATA_TYPE_LIST: TEXT, TEXT, TEXT, BOOLEAN, NUMBER, NUMBER
FINDINGS: Models lack tests on their primary keys.
RISK: Risks data reliability and scalability.
BEST_PRACTICES: Apply not_null, unique, or unique_combination_of_columns tests to primary keys.

NAME: Test Coverage
COLUMN_NAME_LIST: MEASURED_AT, TOTAL_MODELS, TOTAL_TESTS, TESTED_MODELS, TEST_COVERAGE_PCT, BASE_TEST_COVERAGE_PCT, STAGING_TEST_COVERAGE_PCT, INTERMEDIATE_TEST_COVERAGE_PCT, MARTS_TEST_COVERAGE_PCT, OTHER_TEST_COVERAGE_PCT, TEST_TO_MODEL_RATIO
DATA_TYPE_LIST: TIMESTAMP_TZ, NUMBER, NUMBER, NUMBER, NUMBER, NUMBER, NUMBER, NUMBER, NUMBER, NUMBER, NUMBER
FINDINGS: Not all models have tests.
RISK: Decreases confidence in data accuracy.
BEST_PRACTICES: Apply generic or singular tests to models. Aim for 100% coverage with at least not_null and unique tests on primary keys.

NAME: Undocumented Models
FINDINGS: Models lack descriptions.
RISK: Hinders understanding and discoverability of models.
BEST_PRACTICES: Add descriptions to models using YAML or docs blocks. Prioritize marts models.

NAME: Documentation Coverage
COLUMN_NAME_LIST: MEASURED_AT, TOTAL_MODELS, DOCUMENTED_MODELS, DOCUMENTATION_COVERAGE_PCT, BASE_DOCUMENTATION_COVERAGE_PCT, STAGING_DOCUMENTATION_COVERAGE_PCT, INTERMEDIATE_DOCUMENTATION_COVERAGE_PCT, MARTS_DOCUMENTATION_COVERAGE_PCT, OTHER_DOCUMENTATION_COVERAGE_PCT
DATA_TYPE_LIST: TIMESTAMP_TZ, NUMBER, NUMBER, NUMBER, NUMBER, NUMBER, NUMBER, NUMBER, NUMBER
FINDINGS: Not all models have descriptions.
RISK: Makes it harder for others to understand the models.
BEST_PRACTICES: Add descriptions to models using YAML or docs blocks.

NAME: Undocumented Source Tables
FINDINGS: Source tables lack descriptions.
RISK: Makes it harder to understand the source data.
BEST_PRACTICES: Add descriptions to source tables using YAML or docs blocks.

NAME: Undocumented Sources
FINDINGS: Sources lack descriptions.
RISK: Makes it harder to understand how data is loaded into the warehouse.
BEST_PRACTICES: Add descriptions to sources using YAML or docs blocks.

NAME: Test Directories
FINDINGS: Model tests are not in the same directory as the model.
RISK: Disorganized tests make it harder to find and maintain them.
BEST_PRACTICES: Move tests to a YAML file in the same directory as the model.

NAME: Model Naming Conventions
FINDINGS: Models don't have the correct prefix (e.g., stg_, int_, fct_, dim_).
RISK: Confusing for users; model type isn't clear.
BEST_PRACTICES: Add the appropriate prefix to model names.

NAME: Source Directories
FINDINGS: Source definitions are not in the correct subdirectory.
RISK: Makes it harder to find and manage source definitions.
BEST_PRACTICES: Move source definitions to a YAML file in the subdirectory matching the source.

NAME: Model Directories
FINDINGS: Models are not in the correct subdirectory.
RISK: Poor organization makes it hard to find models.
BEST_PRACTICES: Move staging models to a subfolder matching their source. Nest other models closest to the folder matching their type.

NAME: Chained View Dependencies
FINDINGS: Models depend on long chains of views or ephemeral models.
RISK: Can lead to long runtimes due to nested queries.
BEST_PRACTICES: Change the materialization of some upstream models to table or incremental. Prioritize views used by many models or those with complex calculations.

NAME: Exposure Parents Materializations
FINDINGS: Exposures reference sources or models that are not materialized as tables.
RISK: Exposures should reference transformed data, and their parents should be performant for downstream use.
BEST_PRACTICES: If referencing a source, incorporate the data into a model. Change the materialization of model parents to table or incremental.

NAME: Exposures Dependent on Private Models
FINDINGS: Exposures reference private models.
RISK: Exposures should reference trusted, public, and contracted data sources.
BEST_PRACTICES: Change the access configuration of the referenced models to public. Consider adding contracts and full documentation to these models as well.

NAME: Undocumented Public Models
FINDINGS: Public models lack complete documentation (model and column descriptions).
RISK: Reduces usability for downstream consumers.
BEST_PRACTICES: Add a model description and descriptions for each column in public models.

NAME: Public models without contracts
FINDINGS: Public models lack contracts.
RISK: No guarantees about data types or columns for downstream consumers.
BEST_PRACTICES: Add the contract configuration to public models and specify data types and columns.
